intro: Ferula linkii, commonly known as the Kashmiri ferula, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and feathery leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are thick and fleshy, often used in traditional medicine for their aromatic and medicinal properties. Ferula linkii is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
